intro: Andromeda nuda, commonly known as the naked andromeda, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny conditions. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in spring. Andromeda nuda is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
